content: Museum in Singapore The **Nei Xue Tang Museum** ("Hall of Inner Learning") ([Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 内学堂) is a private museum of [Buddhist art](/wiki/Buddhist_art) in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It is the first home museum in Singapore. The museum was created by collector Woon Wee Teng under a program enacted by the Singapore government to allow collectors to show their collections in their own homes. Opened in 2005, the collection is located in a four-storey pre-war house built in the [Peranakan](/wiki/Peranakan) style on [Cantonment Road](/wiki/Cantonment_Road,_Singapore). It is Singapore's first home museum. The museum is by invitation only. Singaporean billionaire businessman, [Oei Hong Leong](/wiki/Oei_Hong_Leong), houses most of his 50,000-piece collection of Buddhist artifacts at the Museum. In 2007, Woon announced plans for a much larger museum to house more Buddhist artifacts.
